description: '''Dennis Emmanuel Brown''' [[Order of Distinction|CD]] (1 February 1957 â€“ 1 July 1999) was a [[Jamaica|Jamaican]] [[reggae]] singer. During his prolific career, which began in the late 1960s when he was aged eleven, he [[sound recording and reproduction|recorded]] more than 75 albums and was one of the major stars of [[lovers rock]], a subgenre of [[reggae]]. [[Bob Marley]] cited Brown as his favourite singer, dubbing him "The Crown Prince of Reggae", and Brown would prove influential on future generations of reggae singers.
